intro: Hieracium iodobasis, commonly known as the iodine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are rough and hairy, with a distinctive yellowish or whitish underside, and its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium iodobasis is often found in areas with moderate moisture and well-drained soils.
